full_translation:
**The Scripture of Orthodox Unity’s Ritual Texts: The Rite of the Grand Offering for Protecting the State and Appeasing the Seas**

The *Scripture of Orthodox Unity’s Ritual Texts: The Rite of the Grand Offering for Protecting the State and Appeasing the Seas* is of uncertain authorship, likely composed during the Northern and Southern Dynasties. It is one of the surviving fragments of the early Celestial Masters’ scripture *The Ritual Texts of Orthodox Unity*. One scroll. Based on the text from *The Orthodox Daoist Canon*, Proper Section I.

The Most High addressed the Immortal Dou Ziming, saying: "When future rulers and emperors encounter instability in their lands—when the celestial bodies fall into disorder, the sun and moon lose their proper course, yin and yang fall out of harmony, warfare arises on all sides, pestilence spreads, and the multitudes suffer death and injury—you and your disciples should hasten to perform rites of salvation and disaster-aversion, invoking blessings and dispelling obstacles to eliminate calamities. You ought to establish a grand offering based on the *River Chart*, making universal supplications to the Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors, the sun, moon, and constellations, the Jade Armillary and Jade Balance, the Thirty-Six Earths, the sacred mountains and great rivers, the grotto-palaces of the immortals, and the local earth deities.

Prepare one thousand two hundred trays of food, cakes, and fruits, along with golden dragons, jade rings, silk inscribed with the adept’s life-destiny, five-colored ritual banners for the five directions, golden coins, silk for offerings, banners, incense, lamps, candles, seats for the divine officials, memorial documents, paper, brushes, and ritual knives—all arranged with utmost purity and order. Exhaust your sincerity in presenting memorials, repenting transgressions, and beseeching blessings and grace with offerings of faith.

The Son of Heaven shall use a bolt of silk; feudal lords, a *zhang*; and commoners, a *chi*. Alternatively, three hundred sixty trays or two hundred forty trays may be used. Appoint diligent Daoists—twelve, nine, or three in number—who, after bathing, purifying themselves, burning incense, donning clean robes, and observing abstinence, shall ascend the altar on an auspicious day to perform the rites and make universal supplications. Upon completion, distribute the golden dragons, jade rings, blue paper, blue silk, silver tablets, counting rods, and ritual tallies to the sacred mountains and great rivers. Present memorials and offerings, using thirty-six trays of food, cakes, and fruits—or twenty-four trays. Arrange the silk inscribed with the adept’s life-destiny, the five-colored ritual banners, golden coins, silk for offerings, incense, oil lamps, candles, paper, brushes, and seats for the divine officials in descending order of their original quantities. Display them in full array to address the immortals of the grotto-palaces, presenting your sincerity to invoke blessings and avert disasters. Cast the offerings into limpid pools or mountain caverns to safeguard the state’s destiny, recording the names of the immortals. The inscriptions on the silver tablets shall follow the *Lingbao* talisman format, concealed in the depths of mountains or waters. If kept secret, blessings shall descend; if revealed, misfortune shall arrive, plunging one into eternal darkness without divine protection."

The Most High further instructed Ziming: "Those who study the Dao and seek immortality must devote themselves earnestly, laboring for the state and aiding the people, placing others before themselves. Through memorials, offerings, coins, and dispersed acts of merit—such as almsgiving to the poor, constructing quiet abodes, burning incense, lighting lamps, aiding all beings, releasing life, and delivering the dead—when their merits reach three thousand, they shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight."

Thereupon, Dou Ziming and his assembly prostrated themselves, unanimously praising the teaching, and withdrew after paying their respects.

The Heavenly Master declared: "As pure virtue wanes and deceit proliferates, the Dao and virtue decline, and a hundred disasters arise, causing the land to become unstable, households to wither, omens and monstrosities to emerge, pestilence to spread, livelihoods to falter, and misfortune to strike with every move. Some may suffer demotion, loss of office, or stagnation in rank; others may face resentment, slander, or humiliation. There may be theft, banditry, or disturbances within and without, leading to the loss of territory and the people’s wealth. Fear and chaos may drive the populace to rebellion, or descendants may turn against their kin, causing households to decline. All undertakings may go awry, and every action may bring misfortune. In such times, one should perform offerings to the dragon deities—whether the dragons of the sea, rivers, or household waters—and worship them as one sees fit.

The offering rites must be pure and solemn. Use the finest seasonal fruits, ensuring they are fragrant. Perform the rites on an auspicious day, continuing for three years to bring peace to the state and prosperity to the people, filling granaries with grain. After nine years, gold and silk shall accumulate, and all endeavors shall succeed. This method is divinely efficacious; the Dao does not deceive.

For the ritual seats, use gold, silver, and precious treasures, along with silk banners and brocade robes, to clothe the dragon deities."

Five golden dragons, each weighing one tael; *benming* patterned silk, with the Son of Heaven using one bolt of purple-patterned silk and feudal lords using *benming* silk. Five-directional ritual silks follow the colors of their respective directions: nine bolts for the East, three for the South, seven for the West, five for the North, and twelve for the Center. Crimson-patterned silk of three zhang and five chi, and for the Son of Heaven, three hundred fifty chi—these serve as ritual tokens of sincerity.

The Divine King of the Eastern Sea, Sovereign of Waters, wears upon his head the Great Dawn Treasure Radiance Crown. His robe is of azure brocade adorned with kingfisher-feather patterns, and his sash bears the Azure Numinous Nine-Colored Lion-and-Tiger Initiation Satchel. On the days of *Lichun* and the Spring Equinox, he mounts a jade-green chariot drawn by flying dragons and ascends to the High August Jade Emperor to inscribe the records of sins expunged and immortals registered, presenting his memorial before the Jade Emperor of Supreme Purity.

The Divine King of the Southern Sea, Sovereign of Waters, wears upon his head the Great Dawn Treasure Radiance Crown. His robe is of crimson brocade, and his sash bears the Cinnabar Numinous Three-Colored Striking Satchel. On the days of *Lixia* and the Summer Solstice, he rides a dragon-drawn flying cloud chariot and ascends to the High August Jade Emperor to inscribe the records of sins expunged and immortals registered, presenting his memorial before the Jade Emperor of Supreme Purity.

The Divine King of the Western Sea, Sovereign of Waters, wears upon his head the Great Dawn Treasure Radiance Crown. His robe is of white brocade with flying patterns, and his sash bears the White Numinous Life-Spirit Seal and the Nine-Colored Lion-and-Tiger Initiation Satchel. On the days of *Liqiu* and the Autumn Equinox, he mounts a white mist flying chariot and ascends to the High August Jade Emperor to inscribe the records of sins expunged and immortals registered, presenting his memorial before the Jade Emperor of Supreme Purity.

The Divine King of the Northern Sea, Sovereign of Waters, wears upon his head the Great Dawn Treasure Radiance Crown. His robe is of *qi*-brocade with flying patterns, and his sash bears the Vast Release Seven Primes Five-Colored Lion-and-Tiger Initiation Satchel. On the days of *Lidong* and the Winter Solstice, he mounts a *qi*-mist flying chariot and ascends to the High August Jade Emperor to inscribe the records of sins expunged and immortals registered, presenting his memorial before the Jade Emperor of Supreme Purity.

For the rites of offering to the sea deities, one must perform the offerings on the celestial days corresponding to the four seasons. Additionally, on the fifteenth day of the first, seventh, and tenth months, present the ledgers of merits, transgressions, blessings, and retributions—life and death records—before the Three Palaces of Heaven. Those destined for rebirth are recorded in the Left Palace; those destined for immortality, in the Central Palace; and those destined for death, in the Right Palace. Matters concerning demotions, long-term servitude, great and small kalpas, and the myriad spirits of the waters are all reported in accordance with their causes, ensuring correspondence between the celestial and terrestrial realms. If there are those whose *qi* remains unrectified, they are to be examined and corrected during the three assemblies. The Three Officials—of Heaven, Earth, and Water—are also invoked.

Next, visualize the deities.
Next, strike the celestial drum.

Next, kindle the incense burner.
The Most High Mysterious Origin, Five Numinous Venerable Lord, now summons the Merit Recorders and Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, the Incense-Bearing Envoys, and the Three *Qi* Rectifying Deities. Urgently report and present this to the Three Heavens’ Most High Mysterious Origin Dao Lord: we now burn incense and perform this offering rite, swiftly delivering it before the Imperial Presence.
Bow twice.

Next, declare the ritual rank:
Great Immortal Capital, Orthodox Unity, Balanced *Qi*—this Daoist of the Celestial Master’s lineage, the minor male official, your servant [Name], bows twice with reverence.

Respectfully invoke:
The Eastern Supreme Ninefold Mystery Jade Void Imperial Sovereign, Great Clarity Mysterious Origin;
The Most High Lord of the Great Dao of the Primordial Ultimate of the Three Heavens, the Venerable Lord of the Many Masters, the Jade Maidens of Tang Valley, the Great Imperial Lord of Fusang, the Heavenly Imperial Lord;
The Central Yellow Venerable Lord, the Nine Elder Immortal Capital Lords, the Nine *Qi* Masters, the Jade Throne of Great Clarity, the Jade Treasure King of Supreme Clarity and Great Perfection, the Prime Minister and Eastern Sea Jade Gate’s Eastern Florescence Youth Lord, the High Immortals and Myriad Sages of the Mysterious Ultimate Heavenly Worthies.
Bow twice.

Respectfully invoke the Eastern Sea Spirit, Lord Aming Hegui.
Bow twice.
Respectfully invoke the Southern Sea Spirit, Lord Zhushi Liuxiao.
Bow twice.
Respectfully invoke the Western Sea Spirit, Lord Chengli Koulai.
Bow twice.
Respectfully invoke the Northern Sea Spirit, Lord Yuqiang Haocinqiang.
Bow twice.
Respectfully invoke the Water Emperor Spirits, Divine Officials, and Dragon Kings of Tang Valley’s Azure Florescence and Fangzhu Palace;
Respectfully invoke the Water Emperor Spirits, Divine Officials, and Dragon Kings of the Azure Numinous Southern Water Assembly Palace;
Respectfully invoke the Spirits, Divine Officials, and Dragon Kings of the Northern Capital’s Luodeng Palace;
Respectfully invoke the Three Spirit Immortals of the Azure Sea, the Water Emperors of Penglai, Fangzhang, and Yingzhou, and the Divine Officials and Dragon Kings of all their palaces;
Respectfully invoke the Five Directions’ Dragon Spirit Lords;
Respectfully invoke the Five Directions’ Dragon Kings;
Respectfully invoke the Five Directions’ Dragon King Elders;
Respectfully invoke the Eastern Azure Emperor and Azure Dragon Spirit King;
Respectfully invoke the Southern Vermilion Emperor and Vermilion Dragon Spirit King;
Respectfully invoke the Western White Emperor and White Dragon Spirit King;
Respectfully invoke the Northern *Qi* Emperor and *Qi* Dragon Spirit King;
Respectfully invoke the Central Yellow Emperor and Yellow Dragon Spirit King;
Respectfully invoke the Heavenly Flying Dragon Spirit Lords;
Respectfully invoke the Earthly Reclining Dragon Spirit Lords;
Respectfully invoke the Sun and Moon Dragon Spirit Lords;
Respectfully invoke the Constellation Dragon Spirit Lords;
Respectfully invoke the Cloud Dragon and Rain Dragon Spirit Lords;
Respectfully invoke all the Dragon Spirit Lords of the Five Marchmounts, sacred mountains, hills, and mounds;
Respectfully invoke the Dragon Spirit Lords guarding the nation’s lands, palaces, and treasuries;
Respectfully invoke the River Earls and River Lords of the Three Rivers, Nine Jiang, Four Seas, Four Marshes, grotto sources, limpid pools, thousand streams, ten thousand valleys, and Twelve Huai waterways, as well as the Water Emperors, Water Palaces, and all Dragon Spirit Lords of the Four Directions and Eight Extremities.
May all don their solemn attire, crowns, and descend to the ritual space to partake in the offerings.
Bow twice.

Your servant [Name] respectfully petitions the Eastern Sea Youth Lord, the Divine Officials, Water Emperors, and all Dragon Kings and Spirit Lords of the sea’s palaces and water palaces:
By fortunate karmic destiny, I was born into this world and humbly entered the Daoist lineage. My heart yearns to aid and deliver, to assist the nation and sustain life, to save and ferry the multitudes. Trembling with awe, I now present my sincere words.
Next, recite the petition.

According to the petition’s profound sincerity and earnest prayers, having received this trust and reverence, I dare not remain silent. I humbly submit that His Imperial Majesty’s heart is set upon humble palaces and frugal meals, nurturing the common people while bearing heaven’s heavy charge. He wishes to practice virtue and the Dao, desiring to widely bestow imperial transformation, govern through non-action, reflect thrice and ponder ninefold, secure the ancestral altars, and harmonize all under heaven to fulfill his aspirations. Relying upon the sea spirits and dragon kings, may they graciously condescend to this offering rite, descend in mercy to partake, and gather blessings for the nation.
Respectfully presented for your awareness.
Your servant [Name] bows twice.

Next, offer incense.
Your servant [Name] respectfully petitions the Sea Spirits, Dragon Kings, Water Emperors, Water Palaces, and all their divine officials:
May the great compassion of the numinous spirits descend, responding to the pleas of the living. May grace flow to the sentient and blessings extend to the insentient. May a single return of divine aid amplify our sincerity, and unseen blessings be added in support. May the Emperor’s divine majesty reach afar, his plans and strategies grow ever clearer, his insight penetrate the obscure, and his foreknowledge discern all matters. May every prayer and wish be fulfilled, the realm know peace, and the multitudes enjoy prosperity. May the Six Directions return to harmony, like stars revolving around the celestial pole; may all nations come to pay homage, like rivers flowing to the sea. May weapons be laid down, armor stilled, horses released, and oxen rested. May the people be nurtured without severity, governed without coercion. May virtue and the Dao be cultivated to repay great kindness. May heavenly disasters dissolve like clouds, and earthly calamities scatter like mist. May ministers be loyal and children filial, rulers benevolent and fathers kind.

May the Emperor eternally uphold the celestial honor, unchanging as heaven; may the Empress long occupy the earthly dignity, immovable as earth. May the Crown Prince, imperial princes, and brothers all take deep root, the imperial lineage flourishing abundantly, its branches enduring for ten thousand years and a thousand autumns, their glory unceasing. May all under heaven know no disasters, hells cease their suffering, prisons end their litigations, and all beings receive blessings. By the divine power of the spirits, may every wish be fulfilled, all virtues gather, and boundless grace be received.
Your servant [Name] bows twice.

Next, offer incense.
Your servants [Names] respectfully petition the Eastern Sea Youth Lord, the Divine Officials, Water Emperors, and all Dragon Kings and Spirit Lords of the sea’s palaces and water palaces:
The Emperor now seeks blessings and averts calamities, invoking all these divine officials to present this modest offering. May the Great Sages and Mysterious Ones deign to witness it, responding as swiftly as echo follows sound. No further words are needed, nor repetition required. The rites of gratitude are complete, the incense offering concluded. May your cloud chariots and jade carriages, feathered canopies ascending, not tarry as the shadows shift and time passes. The lower realm is desolate and impure, unfit for prolonged stay. May you bestow compassion, extending vast grace.
Your servant [Name] bows twice and respectfully escorts the deities’ departure.

Next, chant the hymn of farewell.
Next, offer incense.

Next, replenish the incense burner. To the Incense Official Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attending Spirit Officials of the incense:
May the naturally arising golden liquid, cinnabar essence, and mushroom spirits of this offering site gather here before this incense altar. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected beings converge in this place. May we who study the Dao attain transcendence and ascend as immortals. May the Emperor receive blessings, and the realm be graced in all ten directions. May jade maidens and immortal youths attend the incense smoke, conveying our words directly before the divine.

**The Primordial Numinous Treasure’s Decree to the Water Emperors for the Erasure of Sins from the Tablet**

The Numinous Treasure [addresses] the Water Emperors:
[Name], styled [Courtesy Name], aged [X] years, born in the [X] month, prays for divine favor and immortal longevity, that the Three Origins may endure and the Nine Palaces’ Water Emperors and the twelve river sources’ great spirits of the Jiang, Hai, Huai, and Ji—along with the numinous deities of the underworld—erase his sinful name and report it to the Nine Heavens. He petitions to proceed to the Water Palace’s Golden Dragon Post for transmission.

In the [X] year of the Great Year, the [X] month, the [X] day of the new moon, this decree is proclaimed in [X] kingdom.

Write the above in vermilion on a silver tablet, wrap the tablet in blue paper, bind it with blue silk, and let a golden dragon bear it into the depths of the Three Rivers.

Next, strike the teeth three times.
Next, ignite the incense burner.

From the Primordial Three Heavens above, clouds gather—

Next, the tablet is placed upon the altar, and the prayer is recited:

"Primal Origin and Five Thearchs, Supreme Lords on High,
The perfected of the ten directions, the numinous immortals of Mount Taihua,
By the vermilion script’s decree, no hidden realm remains untouched.
Ascending to the Nine Heavens, we petition for the descent of the Jade Text.
Sun and moon, the Five Stars, the Northern Dipper’s Seven Origins,
We now address the Five Marchmounts and the sacred mountains of the four quarters,
And below, the rivers and seas, the twelve water sources,
The Water Emperors of the Nine Palaces, the great spirits of the underworld.
Today, we make this supplication on high,
That all vows be laid forth:
We present the jade tablet, beseeching the erasure of sinful names.
For a thousand generations and ten thousand ancestors, the nine clans’ karmic ties,
Their transgressions have stained this body—
May all be expunged, their roots severed,
Their names recorded in the Water Palace,
Their deeds reported before the Supreme Lord.
May the seven ancestors and parents escape the Eight Difficulties,
Ascend to the Nine Heavens,
And be clothed in raiment divine.
May these sins dissolve and scatter,
Heard by the myriad spirits.
We entreat the Water Officials to seal this covenant with the Golden Dragon,
And transmit it as petitioned at the Golden Dragon Post."

Next, offer incense.
Next, close the incense burner.

The Incense Officials and Messengers invoke the rites,
The Primordial Numinous Treasure’s Petition to the Mountains for Ascension to Immortality—
Supreme Numinous Treasure, Master So-and-so of such-and-such rank, aged so many years, born in such-and-such month,
Destined under such-and-such Lord,
Named in affiliation with such-and-such mountain,
Aspires to transcendence, to immortality,
To eternal deliverance and ascension,
To soar as a Perfected One of the Five Sacred Peaks of Highest Clarity,
Utmost in divinity, utmost in numinosity—
Beseeches the erasure of sin from the registers,
The inscription of his name in the Nine Heavens,
And petitions transmission at the Golden Dragon Post of the Numinous Mountain.

In the such-and-such year of the Great Year, such-and-such month, the first day of the month, the hour of the Rat,
The petition is presented at such-and-such sacred peak.

Inscribe this in vermilion upon a silver tablet,
Wrap it in blue-green paper,
Bind it with blue-green silk,
And let the Golden Dragon bear the tablet to cast it into the named mountain.

Next, offer incense.
Next, open the incense burner.

The Most Supreme Three Heavens invoke the rites—
Next, strike the teeth nine times.
Upon completion of the recitation, pray thus:

O Mysterious and Supreme, Radiant and Illuminating,
Primordial Overseer of the Perfected, Supreme Lord of the Five Elders’ Vermilion Script,
Root and Origin of Heaven and Earth,
Sovereign over the Three Primes,
Summoner of the Black Lord’s Assembly,
Expediter of the Ascension of the Loftiest,
Bearer of the Mandate of the Highest—
Universally proclaim to the Ten Heavens’ sun, moon, and stellar lodges,
To the Five Sacred Peaks and Numinous Mountains,
To the earthly and subterranean spirits of great numinosity:
Oversee the Register of Life,
Preside over the Southern Three Gates,
Receive the jade tablet,
Inscribe the name upon the vermilion scroll,
Expunge the records of sin,
Uphold the imperial ministers,
The thousand generations and ten thousand ancestors,
The nine clans’ karmic ties—
May all attain liberation from the Five Paths and Eight Difficulties,
Escape the Three Evil Realms,
Their souls ascend to the Nine Heavens,
Delivered from the cycle of birth and death,
Preserved through ten thousand kalpas.
Today, we make this supplication on high,
That the myriad spirits heed this entreaty.
We beseech the Perfected Officials to seal this covenant with the Golden Dragon,
And transmit it as petitioned at the Golden Dragon Post.

Next, offer incense.
Next, close the incense burner.

The Incense Officials and Envoys, in their numinous radiance,
Receive the *Lingbao* Simplified Petition for the Homestead.

The *Lingbao* Sovereign of Such-and-Such,
Master So-and-So, aged such-and-such years,
born in such-and-such month,
whose fate is bound to the Nine Heavens and Northern Dipper,
whose register is held by the spirits of aspiration and transcendence,
seeks long life and deliverance from the world,
to soar through the Upper Clarity and Central August Nine Lands,
to the Earthly Yellow Thearchs of the Wuji and Ji Palaces,
where his records of sin are expunged,
his name inscribed in the Supreme Mystery.
He petitions to present his petition at the Central Palace,
to record his name upon the golden tablet,
and to transmit it as sworn at the Golden Dragon Post.

In the such-and-such year, month, and day of the Great Year,
at the such-and-such purification altar, this is proclaimed below.

Inscribe in vermilion upon a silver tablet,
wrap it in azure paper,
bind it with nine strands of azure silk,
and affix a golden dragon.
Bury it at the Central Palace,
all in accordance with the above rites.

Next, in the central courtyard, face the Thearch,
knock the teeth twelve times,
and read the petition to its end.
Then pray:

The heavens unfold, the earth extends,
the Nine Blacks divide their numinosity,
the Three Primes’ grotto-palaces,
the Ten Directions shine in clarity.
The Five Venerable Thearchs,
open the true and guard life.
Vermilion script, crimson writ,
the primordial essence of the Highest Clarity,
proclaimed throughout the world,
to the numinous spirits of the Nine Lands.
Today, this is proclaimed on high,
the myriad immortals fix their names.
I, aspiring to transcendence,
present my jade name,
to the Supreme Palace of the Great August,
where sins are erased and punishments annulled.
The petition is submitted to the Upper Offices,
inscribed in the registers of Flourishing Clarity.
May I soon ascend in flight,
sharing the numinosity of heaven and earth.
May the nine clans and karmic kin,
though their bones decay, be glorified anew,
their souls ascend to the Southern Palace,
to receive transformation in the immortal courts.
On this auspicious day, the decree is proclaimed,
the myriad spirits all heed.
We beseech the Golden Dragon to bear witness,
sealing this covenant with utmost sincerity.
As petitioned, transmit it at the Golden Dragon Post.

Next, offer incense.
Next, close the incense burner.

The Incense Officials and Envoys, as per the rites—
here concludes the *Scripture of Orthodox Unity Ritual Texts: The Maritime Offering for State Protection*.

chunks.original_text: 正一法文经护国醮海品 经名：正一法文经护国醮海品。 撰人不详，约出於南北朝。 系早期天师道经典《正一法文》残本之一。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 正一法文经护国醮海品 太上告仙人豆子明曰：将来国主帝王有国土不安，星宿错度，日月失昏，阴阳不调，兵革四起，疫毒流行，兆民死伤，汝等徒众宜加救护禳灾，请福灭障消殃，宜设河图普告大醮，以谢三十二天，三十二帝，日月星宿，游玑玉衡，三十六地，名山大川，仙宫洞府，土地真官。 可用饮食饼果千二百盘，金龙环璧，本命纹缯，五方镇彩，金钱镇绢，幡香灯烛，仙官神座，章信纸笔书刀事事洁序，罄竭丹诚，奏上章表，悔谢愆负，祈请福恩镇信之物。 天子用疋，诸侯用丈，庶人用尺，亦可三百六十盘，亦可二百四十盘，可令精勤道士一十二人，亦可九人，亦可三人，沐浴清争烧香洁服斋戒，吉日登坛，启告遍谢事讫，即以醮座金龙环璧青纸青丝银板筹算散诣名山大川，章醮投告，可用饮食饼果三十六盘，亦可二十四盘，其本命纹缯五方镇彩金钱缯绢香油灯烛纸笔神座之具，事事降臧元数，罗列敷陈，以告洞府仙官，具陈丹款，请福禳灾，投於清玲之渊，山洞之所，保延国祚，记上仙名，其银板题文当如灵宝简式，藏投深山深水，勿使漏泄密则福降，泄则祸臻，长沦幽夜，终不蒙佑。 太上重告子明日，夫学仙道士宜笃志勤苦，为国立功，救护苍生，先物后己，章醮钱铢座席散造功德，舍施贫穷，营建静舍，烧香然灯，念济一切，放生度死，功满三千，白日升天。 是时豆子明等首体投地，同声称善，作礼而退。 天、师君日，自淳风渐薄，浇伪竞生，道德不行，百灾俱起，能令国土不安，居家虚耗，妖怪互出，疫疾流行，生事轴轲，动遭凶祸，或弹官黜职，禄位不进，贵贱怨憎，谤毁凌辱。 或偷盗劫掠，惊动.内外，国失土境，民丧钱财，恐放纵横民人死叛，或儿孙反乱，门户不昌，所作违心，举动不利，若有此灾，皆宜醮杞龙神或海龙江龙河水宅龙，任意祀之。 醮法须清争，诸果实随时所珍，每令芳香，当用吉日，三年为之，国安民丰，家内富溢，米谷盈仓，九年为之，金帛自积，所向果从此法神验，道不欺人。 其镇座用金银珍宝； 缯彩锦衣，着座上龙神衣之；

**The Scripture of Orthodox Unity’s Ritual Texts: The Rite of the Grand Offering for Protecting the State and Appeasing the Seas**

The *Scripture of Orthodox Unity’s Ritual Texts: The Rite of the Grand Offering for Protecting the State and Appeasing the Seas* is of uncertain authorship, likely composed during the Northern and Southern Dynasties. It is one of the surviving fragments of the early Celestial Masters’ scripture *The Ritual Texts of Orthodox Unity*. One scroll. Based on the text from *The Orthodox Daoist Canon*, Proper Section I.

The Most High addressed the Immortal Dou Ziming, saying: "When future rulers and emperors encounter instability in their lands—when the celestial bodies fall into disorder, the sun and moon lose their proper course, yin and yang fall out of harmony, warfare arises on all sides, pestilence spreads, and the multitudes suffer death and injury—you and your disciples should hasten to perform rites of salvation and disaster-aversion, invoking blessings and dispelling obstacles to eliminate calamities. You ought to establish a grand offering based on the *River Chart*, making universal supplications to the Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors, the sun, moon, and constellations, the Jade Armillary and Jade Balance, the Thirty-Six Earths, the sacred mountains and great rivers, the grotto-palaces of the immortals, and the local earth deities.

Prepare one thousand two hundred trays of food, cakes, and fruits, along with golden dragons, jade rings, silk inscribed with the adept’s life-destiny, five-colored ritual banners for the five directions, golden coins, silk for offerings, banners, incense, lamps, candles, seats for the divine officials, memorial documents, paper, brushes, and ritual knives—all arranged with utmost purity and order. Exhaust your sincerity in presenting memorials, repenting transgressions, and beseeching blessings and grace with offerings of faith.

The Son of Heaven shall use a bolt of silk; feudal lords, a *zhang*; and commoners, a *chi*. Alternatively, three hundred sixty trays or two hundred forty trays may be used. Appoint diligent Daoists—twelve, nine, or three in number—who, after bathing, purifying themselves, burning incense, donning clean robes, and observing abstinence, shall ascend the altar on an auspicious day to perform the rites and make universal supplications. Upon completion, distribute the golden dragons, jade rings, blue paper, blue silk, silver tablets, counting rods, and ritual tallies to the sacred mountains and great rivers. Present memorials and offerings, using thirty-six trays of food, cakes, and fruits—or twenty-four trays. Arrange the silk inscribed with the adept’s life-destiny, the five-colored ritual banners, golden coins, silk for offerings, incense, oil lamps, candles, paper, brushes, and seats for the divine officials in descending order of their original quantities. Display them in full array to address the immortals of the grotto-palaces, presenting your sincerity to invoke blessings and avert disasters. Cast the offerings into limpid pools or mountain caverns to safeguard the state’s destiny, recording the names of the immortals. The inscriptions on the silver tablets shall follow the *Lingbao* talisman format, concealed in the depths of mountains or waters. If kept secret, blessings shall descend; if revealed, misfortune shall arrive, plunging one into eternal darkness without divine protection."

The Most High further instructed Ziming: "Those who study the Dao and seek immortality must devote themselves earnestly, laboring for the state and aiding the people, placing others before themselves. Through memorials, offerings, coins, and dispersed acts of merit—such as almsgiving to the poor, constructing quiet abodes, burning incense, lighting lamps, aiding all beings, releasing life, and delivering the dead—when their merits reach three thousand, they shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight."

Thereupon, Dou Ziming and his assembly prostrated themselves, unanimously praising the teaching, and withdrew after paying their respects.

The Heavenly Master declared: "As pure virtue wanes and deceit proliferates, the Dao and virtue decline, and a hundred disasters arise, causing the land to become unstable, households to wither, omens and monstrosities to emerge, pestilence to spread, livelihoods to falter, and misfortune to strike with every move. Some may suffer demotion, loss of office, or stagnation in rank; others may face resentment, slander, or humiliation. There may be theft, banditry, or disturbances within and without, leading to the loss of territory and the people’s wealth. Fear and chaos may drive the populace to rebellion, or descendants may turn against their kin, causing households to decline. All undertakings may go awry, and every action may bring misfortune. In such times, one should perform offerings to the dragon deities—whether the dragons of the sea, rivers, or household waters—and worship them as one sees fit.

The offering rites must be pure and solemn. Use the finest seasonal fruits, ensuring they are fragrant. Perform the rites on an auspicious day, continuing for three years to bring peace to the state and prosperity to the people, filling granaries with grain. After nine years, gold and silk shall accumulate, and all endeavors shall succeed. This method is divinely efficacious; the Dao does not deceive.

For the ritual seats, use gold, silver, and precious treasures, along with silk banners and brocade robes, to clothe the dragon deities."

chunks.original_text: 金龙五枚，各重一两； 本命纹缯，天子用疋紫纹，王公用命纹； 五方镇彩随方色，东九、南三、西七、北五、中十二座； 绛纹三丈五尺，天子三百五十尺，此物以为法信。 东海水帝神王头建大晨宝明之冠，衣青文翠羽飞裙，带青灵九色狮子虎头肇囊，以立春春分日乘碧辇飞龙，上诣高皇玉帝削罪简注仙录，列奏上清玉皇帝前。 南海水帝神王头建大晨宝明之冠，衣赤锦文裙，带丹灵紫绶三色击囊，常以立夏夏至之日乘蛟龙飞行云舆，上诣高皇玉帝削罪简注仙录，列奏上清玉皇帝前。 西海水帝神王头建大晨宝明之冠，衣素锦飞裙，带素灵命神之章，九色狮子虎头肇囊，常以立秋秋分之日乘素霞飞舆，上诣高皇玉帝削罪简注仙录，列奏上清玉皇帝前。 北海水帝神王头建大晨宝明之冠，衣炁锦飞裙，带豁落七元五色狮子虎头肇囊，常以立冬冬至之日乘炁霞飞舆，上诣高皇玉帝削罪简注仙录，列奏上清玉皇帝前。 凡醮海神法，常随四时上天日醮之，又以正月十五日、七月十五日、十月十五日，率言上天三宫功过罪福生死简簿，应生者言左宫，应仙者言中宫，应死者言右宫，谪役长徒大小劫会水中万灵之事，随所由列言，上下相应，若有考炁未正者，皆申三会考正，又言天地水三官。 次存神 次呜天鼓

Ascending to the Nine Heavens, we petition for the descent of the Jade Text.
Sun and moon, the Five Stars, the Northern Dipper’s Seven Origins,

May all be expunged, their roots severed,
Their names recorded in the Water Palace,
Their deeds reported before the Supreme Lord.
May the seven ancestors and parents escape the Eight Difficulties,
Ascend to the Nine Heavens,
And be clothed in raiment divine.
May these sins dissolve and scatter,
Heard by the myriad spirits.
We entreat the Water Officials to seal this covenant with the Golden Dragon,

chunks.original_text: 香官使者云云 元始灵宝告山简求仙上法 灵宝某帝先生某甲，年如干岁某月生，命属某帝，名系某山，愿神愿仙，长生度世，飞行上清五岳真人，至神至灵，乞削罪籍，上名九天，请诣灵山金龙驿传。 太岁某年某月朔如干日子，於某岳告下。 右朱书银简上，以青纸裹简，青丝缠之，金龙负简以投名山。 次上香 次发炉 无上三天云云 次叩齿九通，读竟，祝曰 玄上开明元始监真上帝五老赤书丹文，天地本始总领三元摄黑君会催促举仙高上符命，普告十天日月星宿，五岳灵山，天下地上冥灵大神，监生主录南上三门关领玉简勒名丹篇，削除罪书上辅帝臣千曾万祖，九族种亲，皆蒙解脱五道八难，去离三恶，魂升九天，生死开度，万劫长存，今日上告万神启闻，请以金龙关盟真官请如所告金龙驿传。 次上香 次复炉
chunks.translated_text:
The Incense Officials and Messengers invoke the rites,
The Primordial Numinous Treasure’s Petition to the Mountains for Ascension to Immortality—
Supreme Numinous Treasure, Master So-and-so of such-and-such rank, aged so many years, born in such-and-such month,
Destined under such-and-such Lord,
Named in affiliation with such-and-such mountain,
Aspires to transcendence, to immortality,
To eternal deliverance and ascension,
To soar as a Perfected One of the Five Sacred Peaks of Highest Clarity,
Utmost in divinity, utmost in numinosity—
Beseeches the erasure of sin from the registers,
The inscription of his name in the Nine Heavens,
And petitions transmission at the Golden Dragon Post of the Numinous Mountain.

In the such-and-such year of the Great Year, such-and-such month, the first day of the month, the hour of the Rat,
The petition is presented at such-and-such sacred peak.

Inscribe this in vermilion upon a silver tablet,
Wrap it in blue-green paper,
Bind it with blue-green silk,
And let the Golden Dragon bear the tablet to cast it into the named mountain.

Next, offer incense.
Next, open the incense burner.

The Most Supreme Three Heavens invoke the rites—
Next, strike the teeth nine times.
Upon completion of the recitation, pray thus:

O Mysterious and Supreme, Radiant and Illuminating,
Primordial Overseer of the Perfected, Supreme Lord of the Five Elders’ Vermilion Script,
Root and Origin of Heaven and Earth,
Sovereign over the Three Primes,
Summoner of the Black Lord’s Assembly,
Expediter of the Ascension of the Loftiest,
Bearer of the Mandate of the Highest—
Universally proclaim to the Ten Heavens’ sun, moon, and stellar lodges,
To the Five Sacred Peaks and Numinous Mountains,
To the earthly and subterranean spirits of great numinosity:
Oversee the Register of Life,
Preside over the Southern Three Gates,
Receive the jade tablet,
Inscribe the name upon the vermilion scroll,
Expunge the records of sin,
Uphold the imperial ministers,
The thousand generations and ten thousand ancestors,
The nine clans’ karmic ties—
May all attain liberation from the Five Paths and Eight Difficulties,
Escape the Three Evil Realms,
Their souls ascend to the Nine Heavens,
Delivered from the cycle of birth and death,
Preserved through ten thousand kalpas.
Today, we make this supplication on high,
That the myriad spirits heed this entreaty.
We beseech the Perfected Officials to seal this covenant with the Golden Dragon,
And transmit it as petitioned at the Golden Dragon Post.

chunks.original_text: 香官使者云云云 元始灵宝告宅简文 灵宝某帝，先生某甲年如干岁，某月生，命系九天北斗，领籍愿神愿仙，长生度世，飞行上清中皇九地戊己黄神土府五帝削除罪录，勒名太玄，请诣中宫投简记名金钮，自信金龙驿传。 太岁某年月朔日子，於某斋坛中告下。 右朱书银简，青纸裹之，青丝缠钮九只金龙，一枚埋住中官，悉如上法？ 次於中庭向王叩齿十二通，读 简竟，祝曰 天开地张，九黑分灵，三元洞府，十方朗清，五老上帝，开真镇生，丹书赤文，元始上精，普告天下，九土皇灵，今日上告，万仙定名，我愿神仙，请投玉名，上府太皇，勒除罪刑，奏简上官，列簿华清，早得飞腾，天地同灵，九祖种亲，腐骸更荣，魂升南宫，受化仙庭，吉日告命，万神咸听，请以金龙，表盟至情，请如所告，金龙驿传。 次捻香 次复炉
chunks.translated_text:
The Incense Officials and Envoys, in their numinous radiance,
Receive the *Lingbao* Simplified Petition for the Homestead.

The *Lingbao* Sovereign of Such-and-Such,
Master So-and-So, aged such-and-such years,
born in such-and-such month,
whose fate is bound to the Nine Heavens and Northern Dipper,
whose register is held by the spirits of aspiration and transcendence,
seeks long life and deliverance from the world,
to soar through the Upper Clarity and Central August Nine Lands,
to the Earthly Yellow Thearchs of the Wuji and Ji Palaces,
where his records of sin are expunged,
his name inscribed in the Supreme Mystery.
He petitions to present his petition at the Central Palace,
to record his name upon the golden tablet,
and to transmit it as sworn at the Golden Dragon Post.

In the such-and-such year, month, and day of the Great Year,
at the such-and-such purification altar, this is proclaimed below.

Inscribe in vermilion upon a silver tablet,
wrap it in azure paper,
bind it with nine strands of azure silk,
and affix a golden dragon.
Bury it at the Central Palace,
all in accordance with the above rites.

Next, in the central courtyard, face the Thearch,
knock the teeth twelve times,
and read the petition to its end.
Then pray:

The heavens unfold, the earth extends,
the Nine Blacks divide their numinosity,
the Three Primes’ grotto-palaces,
the Ten Directions shine in clarity.
The Five Venerable Thearchs,
open the true and guard life.
Vermilion script, crimson writ,
the primordial essence of the Highest Clarity,
proclaimed throughout the world,
to the numinous spirits of the Nine Lands.
Today, this is proclaimed on high,
the myriad immortals fix their names.
I, aspiring to transcendence,
present my jade name,
to the Supreme Palace of the Great August,
where sins are erased and punishments annulled.
The petition is submitted to the Upper Offices,
inscribed in the registers of Flourishing Clarity.
May I soon ascend in flight,
sharing the numinosity of heaven and earth.
May the nine clans and karmic kin,
though their bones decay, be glorified anew,
their souls ascend to the Southern Palace,
to receive transformation in the immortal courts.
On this auspicious day, the decree is proclaimed,
the myriad spirits all heed.
We beseech the Golden Dragon to bear witness,
sealing this covenant with utmost sincerity.
As petitioned, transmit it at the Golden Dragon Post.

Next, offer incense.
Next, close the incense burner.
